TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed EncodingConstraint extends System.Enum

Docs.remarks: Not all message transports support binary or 8-bit data, so it becomes necessary to constrain the content encoding to a subset of the possible Content-Transfer-Encoding values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.EncodingConstraint EightBit = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The content may contain bytes with the high bit set, but must not contain any zero-bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.EncodingConstraint None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: There are no encoding constraints, the content may contain any byte.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.EncodingConstraint SevenBit = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The content may only contain bytes within the 7-bit ASCII range.
